text:
Alberto Aleandro Uderzo (;; 25 April 1927 – 24 March 2020), known as Albert Uderzo, was a French comic book artist and scriptwriter. He was best known for his work on the "Astérix" series and also drew other comics such as "Oumpah-pah", also in collaboration with René Goscinny.
Uderzo died on 24 March 2020 of a heart attack in Neuilly-sur-Seine, France, aged 92.
